etymology.description: Pictogram: a bladed tool to plow and mark a border; alternatively a carpenter’s square (cf. original meaning of 巨).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a tool used to prepare the ground and set boundaries, naturally extending to the idea of labor and work. Some traditions instead see a carpenter’s square, connecting it with making and constructing, and with early senses linked to 巨.

examples.chinese: 我在工厂工作(我在工廠工作)。
这些工人正在劳动(這些工人正在勞動)。
他的工钱很高(他的工錢很高)。
